articles.author: Andrea Shalal, David Lawder
articles.description: Trade experts say structuring the reciprocal tariffs that Trump wants poses big challenges for his team.
articles.title: Trump administration readies reciprocal US tariffs as trade war fears mount

articles.author: James Mackenzie, Jana Choukeir, Maha Dahan
articles.description: Israel's military has called up reservists in preparation for a possible resumption of fighting in Gaza if Hamas fails to meet a Saturday deadline to release more Israeli hostages and a nearly month-old ceasefire breaks down.
articles.title: Israeli military calls up reservists as uncertainty over Gaza ceasefire builds

articles.author: Steve Holland
articles.description: U.S. special envoy Steve Witkoff, on a visit to Russia, secured the release on Tuesday of Marc Fogel, an American schoolteacher detained in Russia since August 2021, the White House said.
articles.title: Trump envoy secures release of American Marc Fogel from Russia

articles.author: Pavel Polityuk, Valentyn Ogirenko, Serhiy Karazy
articles.description: Russia's early morning missile attack on Kyiv killed at least one civilian, injured three, and sparked several fires throughout the city, Ukrainian officials said.
articles.title: Russia's missile attack on Kyiv kills one, sparks fires, Ukraine says

articles.author: Saurabh Sharma
articles.description: More than 10 million devout Hindus seeking absolution from their sins took a dip in holy waters in northern India during a span of four hours on Wednesday, authorities said, as they braced for millions more to swarm the site of the Kumbh Mela.
articles.title: Ten million Indians take holy dip on key day of Kumbh Mela festival

articles.author: Liz Lee, Ben Blanchard
articles.description: Two U.S. Navy ships sailed through the sensitive Taiwan Strait this week in the first such mission since President Donald Trump took office last month, drawing an angry reaction from China, which said the mission increased security risks.
articles.title: First US Navy ships sail through Taiwan Strait since Trump inauguration

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Kazakhstani lawmakers on Wednesday proposed that the country adopt a law restricting "foreign agents", an apparent move to emulate Russia in adopting a measure used to clamp down on government critics.
articles.title: Kazakhstan lawmakers propose Russian-style 'foreign agent' law

articles.author: Lucinda Elliott
articles.description: At Argentina's Ministry of Deregulation and State Transformation, two piles of laws to be streamlined or cut sit on a wooden desk near an Elon Musk biography and a figurine of libertarian President Javier Milei with his iconic chainsaw.
articles.title: How Argentina took a chainsaw to government, a year before Elon Musk's DOGE

articles.author: Ana Mano
articles.description: Brazil's agricultural research agency Embrapa, which helped turn the country into a leading grains exporter, is preparing a 12-year research program that could do the same for cannabis cultivation in the farming powerhouse.
articles.title: Brazil agriculture agency plans long-term research into cannabis cultivation

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A military court in Uzbekistan sentenced 10 defendants to lengthy prison terms for the attempted murder of the former presidential press secretary, the country's supreme court press service said on Wednesday.
articles.title: Uzbek court jails 10 people for attempted killing of ex-presidential spokesperson
